name: Lancaster Gate Hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a pleasant stay here.Check-in was efficient with all the information we needed given.Our room was clean and cheerful though the trouser press was hanging half off the wall. The beds were very comfortable and the bedding nice. The en-suite was quite small - difficult I imagine if you were a larger person but all was clean and working and the tioletries supplied had a pleasant smell. The air conditioning worked wonderfully well and our room's position and the soundproofing meant we slept soundly.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was a very busy affair and the staff struggled to keep up with supplies of food for the buffet and crockery/cutlery for the tables. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and obliging in quite stressful situations and did their best to fulfill requests.The breakfast food available was varied from full English to continental cheese/ham/tomato/cucumber etc,pastriesand rolls to cereals,fruit salad,prunes,yoghourt,whole fresh fruits,and cake muffins.Whole and skimmed milk were available and the usual drinks-fruit juice,teas and coffee.Something to satisfy everyone I think.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Price, Few Problems

likes.liked: — The rooms, air con, and location
likes.disliked: — The dirt in the bathroom, problems with sockets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out was as efficient as check-in and we would be very happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.text: Myself, along with my family stayed at the park inn Hyde Park for 3 nights during august 2008. We booked two twin bedrooms. We had read many reviews of hotels on trip advisor, and also reviews of the park inn Hyde park and we found this one to be the best priced with best reviews, we paid £70 per room, per night, which was quite a good price, especially for central London.
reviews.title: good for a short stay

reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel which, from the outside, wasn’t quite what we were expecting; the hotel does look quite drab and could do with a lick of paint! And there was also a huge renovation going on right opposite the park inn, which meant a lot of noise, vehicles and disturbance for the people staying in the rooms at the front of the hotel; however ours was at the back, which meant we heard no noise at all, and got a very peaceful night sleep. Once we were inside the hotel we greeted with a large bright reception, with sofas, and stairs that led to the bar and dining room. We were served by a very helpful young woman, who checked us in smoothly.
reviews.title: Poor bathroom, small and dirty rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great location. good hotel. we don't have much to compare this one to, but found the room to be quite comfortable. thinner walls but as they stuck us a bit out of the way, this was not a problem for us. we'd come back to this one for sure unless we were absolutely guaranteed something better for less money. might be hard to do in london. booked with laterooms.com, got our good price there - 89GBP
reviews.title: great location.

likes.liked: — very clean, comfortable, walking distance to train, sites

reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Inn for Spring Break. The breakfast was wonderful, but all full English breakfasts get a little boring after a few days. The heat in our room quit and it was very, very cold in mid-March. But the hotel was very accommodating and moved us to another room. The shower was fantastic. The room was a little basic, but the location was wonderful - very close to 3 tube stations, lots of resturants, and the park. Would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The first time I stayed here was during the very wet summer 2007 and everyone was miserable. I took away a poor impression, but I was being unfair. I spent two nights there - 17 and 18 March and for a pretty good rate - less than than £99 quoted elsewhere. I thought the place was good and I will be going back again. The room was comfortable and while not big - it was big enough for one. I was on business and it was important to be near the Tube at Lancaster Gate. Also I was coming in through Paddington which a 10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Really not too bad

likes.disliked: — Blandness - but I was alone on business - so what of balsndess!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's a tip: i thought there was nothing of note around the hotel but turning right out of the front door and right (not left as was my intention) I discovered The Leinster Arms < http://fancyapint.com/pubs/pub1390.html > What a fantastic pub! Well it's OK as a pub but they specialise in pies - oh dear oh dear, I'd stay in the Park Inn just to be near to those pies.
reviews.title: Small, not value for money...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall appearance of the hotel isn't classy, were told that the Hotel was a 4* although it should not warrant that grade. The rooms were very small, looked out to a wall. One small window obstructed by the TV. The shower was ok, sink and mirror crammed in behind the wall. Ceiling in the bathroom in need of some paint, brown and mouldy in corners. I would not stay here again and if I was staying longer than one night I wouldn't have been pleased. Choose this hotel from a list on the Show-and-stay website where we had purchased a deal. OK for one night, no longer. I have to say breakfast was very good, but didnt warrant the £13.50 per head charge.
reviews.title: Good hotel, not sure about the value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as a Mystery Hotel in Hyde Park for £70/night through another website. The hotel was 5mins from nearest tube station and practically on Hyde Park.
reviews.title: Met our requirements

likes.disliked: — Extraction fan in the court yard.....wake me up

reviews.text: Breakfast wasn't great.....it was buffet and the hot food was a little cold.
reviews.title: Not bad at all

reviews.text: Room was clean and the shower was great. We had a room that looked onto the court yard (not very pretty!!) and therefore onto and enormous and very loud extraction fan. This was a bit annoying.
reviews.title: Good location, good hotel
THERE WERE SOME ISSUES..BUT WOULD STAY AGAIN
reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all it was an adequate hotel for the price we paid and we were fairly happy.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, great location

likes.disliked: — Very small rooms and even smaller bathroom

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel over the spring bank weekend booked through show and stay which includes theatre break, rail travel and hotel. Was pleased with the standard of the hotel, changed the sheets every day, even though we were only there two nights. The breakfast was very good included, hot buffet, cold meats and cheeses, cereals, fruit, croissants as much as you want. The rooms were very clean and had blackout curtains, very pleased with the hotel would definately use them again. Not far from the westend either
reviews.title: Enjoyed the hotel

reviews.text: Excellent value and location for the price. Yes, the rooms are small - as in so many other London business hotels, but most importantly, they are clean! My only suggestion is that the hotel use a better quality towel - these are little better than paper.
reviews.title: Who could ask for more - clean, good location by Tube

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk staff was friendly and helpful with directions. While my stay included full breakfast, I did not partake,thus I can not comment on the quality of the food.
reviews.title: Great Location, small rooms

reviews.text: Be aware there is constuction across the street from the front of the hotel (and it looks like it will last for a while - rehabbing a large building)so ask for a room in back. Mine was terrifically silent.
reviews.title: "pleasantly surprised"

reviews.text: As someone who was out all day and did not go out at night,I enjoyed the extra touch of digital TV to give me a wide range of viewing options.
reviews.title: Handy location, cheep and cheerful accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent just one night here. Booked a standard double but were upgraded to a business room on arrival. Not a huge room, but very comfortable with Wifi, bathrobe and slippers, tea & coffee, iron and trouser press and big TV. Bed was comfortable (certainly given the price we paid; have stayed in more expensive places and had a horrible bed) . In the bathroom there was a small bath and good shower with a fixed head and also a hand shower. Water pressure was good. There is a notice to say they set the water temperature to a certain level for safety. I found the water was fine in the evening but not very hot the next morning, but that would be my only complaint.
reviews.title: Would happily return here.

likes.disliked: — room a bit small if planning to spend a lot of time there.

reviews.text: We did not have breakfast as we felt we could get it cheaper somewhere else and did not want 'The Full English'.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The location is very good and close to Lancaster Gate, as other reviewers have said, but I found it is not 9 mins walk from Paddington as they say on the website. It took me at least 15 and I walk quickly!
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.text: The colour scheme is certainly bright and may not be to everyone's taste, but it was all clean. The staff were helpful and friendly and we will happily stay here again.
reviews.title: Pretty good all-rounder

likes.disliked: — Room had rather shabby decor for the price

reviews.text: Booked a one night stay here for a night out in London, and it was excellent value, as soon as you arrive you are mde to feel welcome.
reviews.title: great value hotel

likes.liked: — its location & the good value room rates

reviews.text: We booked 4 double / Twin rooms for 3 nights 11 months in advance and paid £92 per room.
reviews.title: Good value and location but have dinner out elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived slightly early and were able to gain immediate access to our rooms. The hotel lobby is smart and clean and the reception staff very helpful. Our rooms were clean and the bathrooms fine with powerful showers. None of our rooms had views. Three faced a central courtyard containing air conditioning units. However we were on the 4th floor and the noise was minimal. Room air con was very effective. None of the rooms were massive but good value for the money we paid.
reviews.title: But me no buts. Comfortable and convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate dinner in the restaurant on the first night and it was a little disasterous. There were items missing from the menu due to a missed delivery and as a result there was no vegetables and all dishes came with chips. The wine list was not great and the food over priced for the quality.
reviews.title: OK budget hotel

likes.disliked: — facilities are old, staff are not quite up to Radisson standard

reviews.text: Costa Coffee in the bar afterwards was fine for the first six of the group who used all the cups. Others had to wait for the cups to be rewashed before further coffee could be served. After that a round of whiskys were served in half pint glasses due to there being no whisky tumblers.
reviews.title: Satisfactory.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very basic and not very inspiring. Ok if you like coissants and cheese slices.
reviews.title: Convenient situation, helpful staff. Expensive for what you get.

likes.disliked: — Tiny room, indifferent view, intermittently working air-conditioning.

reviews.text: I booked my London stay through Gate 1 travel for a Thanksgiving Special. My 14 year old son joked that the space between the twin size beds were close enough that we could hold hands while laying in bed. We laughed plenty over that. Even though the room was tiny we had a view of the street yet didn't find it noisy at all. It is a really quiet neighborhood. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and the staff were very nice, especially the bartender. The walk to the tube station was not too close but not too far. I did notice that there were other hotels much closer to the tube. On two occasions, when we arrived in the evening, our key card did not work. The person at the front of the hotel accused me of not locking the door properly. However, the last people to have left our rooms would have been their cleaning staff. On that note, the cleaning staff did a great job of tidying the room every day and I left them a nice tip.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

likes.liked: — Very nice lounge and restaurant area.

reviews.text: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Park Inn Hyde Park hotel in London and had a wonderful visit.
reviews.title: Very good choice

likes.liked: — location...Internet cafe and a wonderful Greek restaurant around the corner.
likes.disliked: — Lighting in the room. Flourescent with a yellow cast.

description: Lancaster Gate Hotel is located right across from Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens and is a short stroll away from Portobello Market, Albert Memorial, Albert Halll, Marble Arch and Oxford Street. The hotel features 188 rooms with modern amenities and special facilities for business travellers and families. Our Serpentine Restaurant & Bar offer a wide range of dining options and fabulous breakfast buffets. We also provide 2 meeting rooms for small-scale business reunions and catering options.
